Package org.bonitasoft.engine.api

Interface PlatformAPI

All Known Subinterfaces:
PlatformAPI
public interface PlatformAPI
Manage the platform.

The platform is the base on which runs the engine.
It mainly handles the creation of tables in database and also allow to start/stop a Node which is the current Virtual machine on which runs the engine. There is only one platform for a running Bonita Engine.

Author:
Elias Ricken de Medeiros, Lu Kai, Zhang Bole, Matthieu Chaffotte, Emmanuel Duchastenier

  • Method Details

    • initializePlatform

      @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="8.0.0") void initializePlatform() throws CreationException
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Not useful anymore, initialization is done by the setup tool
      Initialize the platform. The running environment of Bonita Engine is initialized and marked as activated.
      Business elements linked to the execution are initialized, after this step the technical user will be able to connect to the engine and to import the
      Throws:
      InvalidSessionException - occurs if the API session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
      CreationException - occurs when an exception is thrown during platform creation

    • startNode

      void startNode() throws StartNodeException
      Starts the node.

      The node is the currently Java Virtual Machine on which Bonita Engine is running

      Starting the node make the Scheduler service to start and restart elements that were not finished by the Work service on the previous shutdown.

      Throws:
      InvalidSessionException - occurs if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
      StartNodeException - occurs when an exception is thrown during the activation of the node

    • stopNode

      void stopNode() throws StopNodeException
      Stops the node.

      The node is the currently Java Virtual Machine on which Bonita Engine is running

      Stopping the node make the Scheduler service to stop.

      Throws:
      InvalidSessionException - occurs if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
      StopNodeException - occurs when an exception is thrown during the stop of the node

    • getPlatform

      Platform getPlatform() throws PlatformNotFoundException
      Get the platform.
      Returns:
      the Platform object
      Throws:
      InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
      PlatformNotFoundException - occurs when the identifier does not refer to an existing platform

    • isPlatformCreated

      boolean isPlatformCreated() throws PlatformNotFoundException
      Check if the platform created or not.
      Returns:
      true if the platform exists
      Throws:
      InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
      PlatformNotFoundException - occurs when the identifier does not refer to an existing platform

    • getPlatformState

      PlatformState getPlatformState() throws PlatformNotFoundException
      Get the state of the platform of the current node
      Returns:
      PlatformState.STARTED or PlatformState.STOPPED depending on the scheduler state
      Throws:
      InvalidSessionException - Generic exception thrown if API Session is invalid, e.g session has expired.
      PlatformNotFoundException - occurs when the identifier does not refer to an existing platform

    • isNodeStarted

      boolean isNodeStarted()
      Is the current node started?
      Returns:
      true if the node is started, false if not started or if its state cannot be determined.
      Since:
      6.1

    • rescheduleErroneousTriggers

      void rescheduleErroneousTriggers() throws UpdateException
      Reschedules triggers which are in error state.
      Throws:
      UpdateException - If an exception occurs during the scheduling
      Since:
      6.2

    • getClientPlatformConfigurations

      Map<String,byte[]> getClientPlatformConfigurations()
      INTERNAL USE ONLY get client configuration files of the platform
      Returns:
      the client platform configuration files as a map containing file name and file content
      Since:
      7.3

    • getClientTenantConfigurations

      Map<String,byte[]> getClientTenantConfigurations()
      INTERNAL USE ONLY Get client configuration files at tenant level. Since 8.0, as there is only 1 tenant, the tenantId is not relevant anymore.
      Returns:
      the client tenants configuration files as a map with file name and file content
      Since:
      7.3

    • getClientTenantConfiguration

      byte[] getClientTenantConfiguration(long tenantId, String file)
      INTERNAL USE ONLY get client auto login configuration file for tenant
      Returns:
      file content
      Since:
      7.3

    • updateClientTenantConfigurationFile

      void updateClientTenantConfigurationFile(long tenantId, String file, byte[] content) throws UpdateException
      INTERNAL USE ONLY update a single client configuration file of the tenant
      Parameters:
      tenantId - tenant to update
      file - file name to update
      content - the new content of the file
      Throws:
      UpdateException
      Since:
      7.3
